Description
-----------

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) requires a contractor to perform a refit of the Canadian Coast Guard Ship (CCGS) Tanu at a shipyard in Victoria, British Columbia.


Sourcing Strategy
----------------

Pursuant to the Public Services and Procurement Canada’s Supply Manual Article 3.170.10(b), the sourcing strategy related to this procurement will be limited to Canadian-based contractors, specifically those located within Western Canada.


Tendering Procedure
------------------

All interested contractors, both Canadian and foreign, may submit a bid in accordance with the terms and conditions specified in the solicitation documents.


Bidder’s Conference and Site Visit
----------------------------------

An optional bidders’ conference and site visit will be held to allow contractors to familiarize themselves with the refit facility and ask questions of the DFO Contracting Authority.


Documents
---------

A copy of this solicitation notice, as well as the solicitation documents, are available on the Government of Canada’s BuyAndSell website. This solicitation notice and associated documents will be made available through the website in both English and French.


Submission
---------

Where appropriate, contractors are to submit their bid electronically via the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation.


Procurement Business Number
-------------------------

Contractors must have a valid procurement business number (PBN) prior to award of the contract. Producers are advised to register their PBN and become familiar with the services offered by the PBN.


Contact Information
------------------

Should contractors wish to request a debriefing or require any additional information, they are to contact the Contracting Authority, Mr. Poon, Head of Contracting Services.<|reserved_special_token_210|>(excellent formatting throughout the entire output)
